sentences.en: ‘Get out of my house!’ he roared.
A roar of approval resounded through the Ukrainian parliament.
sentences.cn: 一片赞成声在乌克兰议会中回响。

sentences.en: Don't roar at me.
He began to roar when I took the chocolate away.
sentences.cn: 当我把巧克力拿走时,他大哭起来.

sentences.en: He let out a roar of laughter .
His jokes made us all roar.
sentences.cn: 他的玩笑让我们大家哄笑不止.

sentences.en: Local residents saw it plunge towards Earth with a deafening roar.
sentences.cn: 当地的居民看见它伴着一声震耳欲聋的巨响撞向地面。

sentences.en: Now and then they heard the roar of a heavy truck.
sentences.cn: 他们不时地听到大卡车的轰鸣声。

sentences.en: The car roared off down the road.
The crowd roared in delight.
The engines roared.
The machines roar incessantly during the hours of daylight.
sentences.cn: 机器在白天隆隆地响个不停.

sentences.en: The noise was audible even above the roar of the engines.
sentences.cn: 尽管有发动机的轰鸣声,这个噪音还是能够听到.

sentences.en: the roar of the crowd
the throaty roar of the engines
There was a roar of approval.
sentences.cn: 响起一阵热烈的赞同声。

sentences.en: They heard a deep, distant roar.
sentences.cn: 他们听到远处传来一声低沉的怒吼。

sentences.en: Tigers roar and apes whistle.
to roar with laughter
We heard a lion roar.
sentences.cn: 我们听见了狮子的吼声。

sentences.en: You needn't roar at me.

words.tran_cn: 喧闹的；兴胜的；狂风暴雨的
咆哮者；患喘鸣症的马；备受称赞的人或物

trans.tran_cn: 吼叫声，咆哮声，呼啸声，狂笑，大笑
trans.tran_en: a deep, loud noise made by an animal such as a lion, or by someone’s voice
to make a deep, very loud noise
to make a deep, very loud noise

trans.tran_cn: 咆哮，喧闹，吼叫，混乱或吵闹
trans.tran_en: to make a deep, very loud noise

trans.tran_cn: 大声喊出，使…轰鸣，吼，咆啸
